alert.note: Alert for Catahoula; Concordia (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 26 at 12:10AM CDT until May 28 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Louisiana and Mississippi, including the following areas and parishes, in northeast Louisiana, Catahoula and Concordia. In Mississippi, Adams, Covington, Forrest, Franklin MS, Jefferson Davis, Jones, Lamar, Lawrence, Lincoln and Marion. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Additional heavy rainfall of two to three inches over nearly saturated soils will be possible across the area into this afternoon. This may result in localized flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
